Agreed, but it depends on the conversation. You don't have enough info to know for sure how stuff was phrased, but you're probably right.

Depends...some champions have the JOB of going into the back line despite the riskiness if your team messes up or doesn't follow up. For example, Talon, Riven, and Irelia to name three. If your assassins are focusing the tanks in full 5v5 teamfights, there's a problem.
that is if you are ADC and sustained damage mid only. If you are a jungler/top/assassin mid, you HAVE to nuke their priority targets.
So, everyone focusing the tank is wiser? The tank will absorb all the damage while the rest of the team turns our health bars to dust.
It's called peeling your carrys sir derps a lot.  It's rarely a good idea to just dive through their front line and beeline the Adc, unless he's really out of position.

I'd rather be focusing the tank and taking damage from the tank than focusing the ADC and taking damage from the entire enemy team.  If you're already close enough that the enemy ADC is shooting you then sure, shoot them back, but diving the ADC/fed assassin through everyone else will just get you killed for the sake of one auto.
theres a difference though between "throw everything to kill the adc no matter what" and "focus the adc if you can, and don't focus the tank if you can"
*Boy

Sometimes you have to focus the tank, particularly your adc. The squishies can't just dive past the tank, they'll die. Tanks exist for a reason, and late-game adc's can shred them a bit easier. Without a tank on one side, that leaves those squishies heavily vulnerable without a decent amount of cc and peel.

Mages can barrage the backline, assassins can delete the adc and escape, and so on, but don't expect the adc to focus the other adc if it's not safe.

"Just focus ADC" is not really an effective tactics. It is more complicated than that.

Generally you are trying to kill their damage dealers. But that does not mean that all should them.
There are situations where no one from your team can focus any enemy damage dealer and in this situation you have no choice than retreat.

When enemy front line does their job your ADC mostly has no other choice than attacking these frontline tanks as doing otherwise would get him/her killed.

Whole teamfight mechanics is based on killing problematic target without dying yourself. Teamfights are like shifting sands.
